title: Music meets art at Mars Hall
text:
Music meets art at Mars Hall Oct 02, 2015 "Conservatory #2" by Jay Hoagland is part of the season-closing “ART & Music” weekend at Mars Hall Gallery in Martinsville. 
Martinsville — Mars Hall Gallery will close out its 2015 season Columbus Day weekend with a celebration of “ART & Music.” As part of the celebration, the gallery will feature Goldfish Guitars and Fishuku. Timothy Harrington, CEO of Goldfish Guitars, will be playing the fish-design instruments Saturday afternoon, Oct. 10. 
In keeping with the music theme, other works on display include metal sculptures "Conservatory #1,""Conservatory #2" and "Mephisto Waltz" by Jay Hoagland; "The Beatles" by Brian Read; and assemblage "Lenin Singing at the Hollywood Bowl" by Bill Cook. 
"4 X 4, Every Painting has a Story" featuring works by Kris Johnson, Roger Kirby, Elaine Niemi and Elaine Reed is on display in the New Wing. The Main Gallery offers paintings by Leo Brooks, Nancy Baker, Jeanette Steele Esposito, Linda Funk, Sharon Larkin, Nat Lewis, Maurice Michel Lode, Otty Merril, Greg Mort, Cam Noel, Jimmy Reed, Mimo Gordon Riley, Holly Smith, Carl Sublett, Ron Weaver and Eleanor Zuccola. 
Also on exhibit are pinhole photographs by Antonia Small, block prints and silkscreen by Ken Martin, mixed media assemblage by Bill Cook and Constance Kiermaier and driftwood fish by Claire Perry. A variety of quality crafts are available including decoupage by Davene Fahy, turned and carved vessels by Dick Kelly, handcarved birds by Stephen Hill and mixed media stained glass, mosaics and pottery by Dona Bergen. The gallery also offers a large variety of quality antiques and collectibles, vintage jewelry and handmade soaps by Stone House Road Apiary. 
Gallery hours Columbus Day weekend will be from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., Friday through Monday, Oct. 9 through 12. Mars Hall is located 12.7 miles down the St. George peninsula. For more information, call 372-9996 or visit marshallgallery.net or goldfishguitars.com .
